meanings.definition: To beg more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The homeless man was outbegging his friend for spare change.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outbeg the other street performers.
meanings.sent3: The competition for outbegging the most donations was fierce.
meanings.sent4: His puppy eyes were so effective, he was outbegging everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's outbegging skills were unmatched on the busy street corner.

meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts, he could never outbeg the experienced beggar on the corner.
meanings.sent2: The young boy's ability to outbeg others was impressive.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was training to outbeg the world record holder.
meanings.sent4: Her heartfelt story managed to outbeg even the most stoic passersby.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's clever sign helped him outbeg his competitors on the street.

meanings.sent1: The beggar's determination to outbeg everyone else was unwavering.
meanings.sent2: She always found a way to outbeg her fellow panhandlers.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meows were so pitiful, it seemed like it was outbegging for treats.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outbeg others was a testament to his persuasive skills.
meanings.sent5: The old man's outbegging tactics were legendary among the homeless community.
